name: Ash House

reviews.title: good in the rear view mirror...
reviews.text: Hints of Fawlty Towers but without the humour. Unable to access property for 1 hour despite scheduled 4pm arrival. Spacious, private but dingy room, no view of note. Tiny en suite....shower not working on arrival and stayed that way for the two days of our stay this resulted in trekking through the house for a wash. Smell of cat food constantly pervading living quarters. Cats running over kitchen work surfaces! Breakfast was ok-ish. No sense of being welcome - bordering on disinterest. Very disappointing and would definitely not recommend this B&B.
Ash House is a super B&B on the edge of Holmfirth, the town famous for being the setting for BBC TV's Last of the Summer Wine. The excellent hosts are Richard and Loretta.
reviews.title: Classic B&B and Clasic Cars

description: Ash House is an imposing stone built double fronted Victorian mill owner's house on the edge of Holmfirth, overlooking fields and countryside but just ten minutes' walk from shops and restaurants in the centre of Holmfirth.
